meanings.sent1: After the long hike, Sarah felt wearish and just wanted to rest.
meanings.sent2: The wearish puppy yawned and curled up for a nap.
meanings.sent3: The wearish cat tried to play with a toy but ended up falling asleep on it.
meanings.sent4: The wearish old car struggled to climb the steep hill.
meanings.sent5: His wearish expression showed how exhausted he was from the long day.

meanings.sent1: If you run too much, you will wearish yourself out quickly.
meanings.sent2: She tends to wearish easily when she doesn't get enough sleep.
meanings.sent3: The kids always wearish themselves out playing in the park.
meanings.sent4: The marathon runner knew he would wearish before reaching the finish line.
meanings.sent5: Don't wearish yourself by working too hard without breaks.

meanings.definition: Showing signs of wear or deterioration
meanings.sent1: The wearish book had torn pages and a faded cover.
meanings.sent2: The wearish bridge creaked under the weight of the passing cars.
meanings.sent3: The wearish chair wobbled as soon as someone sat on it.
meanings.sent4: The wearish walls of the old castle were covered in ivy.
meanings.sent5: The wearish sign outside the store was barely readable.
